title: Oral History Interview with Drue Calhoun and Margaret Calhoun, March 27, 1979
description: Interview with Drue Calhoun, an early distributor of automatic gas nozzles, and Margaret Calhoun, his wife and business partner, from Gordon, TX. The interview includes Drue Calhoun discissing his early jobs, his move to Denton, his experience operating service stations during the Great Depression, his marriage with Margaret, his service in the Air Force during World War II running maintenance and working in Air Corps Supply in Canada, his venture into the automatic gasoline nozzle industry, the growth and expansion of his business, his wife's role in supporting the business, and their selling of the business to Charles Kregel.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of North Texas Libraries Special Collections and Archives Department.

title: Oral History Interview Part 1 with Frank Cuellar Sr. , 1978
description: Interview (Part 1) with Frank Cuellar, Sr., Mexican American entrepreneur and founder of El Chico Corporation, from Dallas, Texas. The interview includes Cuellar discussing his family’s migration from Mexico, their early life in Texas, his memories of farming, preserving food and surviving without modern conveniences, his early work experiences as a hotel worker, and the beginnings of the Cuellar family’s restaurant ventures that later grew into El Chico.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. title: Oral History Interview Part 2 with Frank Cuellar Sr. , 1978
description: Interview (Part 2) with Frank Cuellar, Sr., Mexican American entrepreneur and founder of El Chico Corporation, from Dallas, Texas. title: Oral History Interview with Margaret Clayton, April 29, 1982
description: Interview with Margaret Clayton, the secretary in treasuries of the Anderson Clayton Brothers Funeral Homes, from Forney, Texas. The interview includes Clayton discussing her family and personal background, her involvement with the company, the development with the Anderson-Clayton Funeral Homes business, the differences between funeral practices from the 1930s versus the 1970s, her experience managing the business during WWII shortages, the advantages of having a family business, her views on government regulations on funeral practices, and her community engagement as a funeral worker.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. title: Oral History Interview with Anne Davis and Don Davis, October 7, 1979
description: Interview with Anne Davis and Don Davis, owners and operators of the Davis Purity Bakery from Denton, Texas. The interview includes Anne Davis and Don Davis discussing the history of the Davis Purity Bakery, their experiences and memories with family farming in Abilene, the Great Depression, the founding and operation of Purity Bakery, the changes in baking equipment and techniques, the role of family labor in small business management, the challenges of pricing and inflation in the food industry, and their community connections in Denton.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. title: Oral History Interview with Claude Edge, March 21, 1982
description: Interview (Part 1) with Claude Edge, owner of Lilly Ice Cream Company, in Bryan, Texas. The interview includes Edge discussing his brief career as a teacher in Pioneer, Texas, founding of Lilly Ice Cream with partners John Cameron Webb and Claude A. Allard, employment, the process of making ice cream, competition from other companies, associations with Anheuser-Busch, new refrigeration technology, sanitation laws and federal regulations on ice cream making, hardships brought on by the Great Depression, the switch to Mellorine ice cream, and the growth of business into the 1950s.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of North Texas Libraries Special Collections and Archives Department.

title: Oral History Interview with Ernest Ellis, June 30, 1981
description: Interview with Ernest Ellis, former owner of Lander's Mercantile, previously known as Frank Ellis Dealer in Everything, in New Hope, Texas. The interview includes Ellis discussing his father's accomplishments, including ownership of the mercantile store, a sugar plantation in Louisiana, and a peddling wagon, and serving on the board of the Works Progress Administration in Dallas. Ellis also discusses his personal history of working in his father's shop, taking over ownership before selling in 1946, personal hobbies, observations of New Hope during the Great Depression, and work in sales before his retirement.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of North Texas Libraries Special Collections and Archives Department.

title: Oral History Interview Part 1 with Ned Estes, June 8, 1982
description: Interview (Part 1) with Ned Estes, the operator of a grocery store, repair shop, and rental cottages, in Mountain Home, Texas. The interview includes Estes discussing his family background, his past employment as an auto mechanic and a ranch hand, his experience in the Air Service, the establishment of a long-running business encompassing auto repair, gasoline, grocery, and cottage rentals with his wife Olive Graham, his experience as a Delco Light products salesman, his family’s generosity during the Great Depression, and his retirement from auto mechanic work.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. title: Oral History Interview Part 2 with Ned Estes, June 10, 1982
description: Interview (Part 2) with Ned Estes, the operator of a grocery store, repair shop, and rental cottages, in Mountain Home, TX. This interview includes Estes discussing the slow development of the Mountain Home area, Estes’ commitment to serving his community, changes in hunting culture including the introduction of exotic game ranches, his lack of vacation due to his work schedule, his tape ministry of spiritual hymns and music in resthomes, his concerns about modern advancements including television, and his dedication to his faith.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact University of North Texas Special Collections at specialcollections@unt.edu.

title: Oral History Interview with Ada Reed and Bob Brewer, March 14, 1984
description: Interview with Ada Reed and Bob Brewer, owners and operators of A. B. McGill and Company General Merchants, from Bertram, Texas. The interview includes Reed and Brewer discussing their upbringing in a small-town, the community role of the general store, their supply and distribution practices, the economical and social shifts in Bertram, the credit business, the strategies to build customer relations and community trust, their involvement with the Texas Retail Association, and their adjustments from clerk-service to self-service retail operations.
source: University of North Texas Oral History Program, University of North Texas Special Collections
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction rights granted by the University of North Texas Libraries. creator: Jenkins, Floyd ; Adams, Stanley Edward; Adams, Elsie
description: Interview (Part 1) with Stanley Edward Adams, a rancher, Board of City Savings chariman, and co-owner of Adams Abstract Company, and Elsie Adams, co-owner of Adams Abstract Company, from Robert Lee, Texas. This interview includes Stanley Edward Adams discussing his childhood on a cotton farm, his first jobs selling popcorn and working around the courthourse, his experiences working in different abstract companies, and his experiences with drilling for oil.

description: Interview (Part 2) with Stanley Edward Adams, a rancher, Board of City Savings chariman, and co-owner of Adams Abstract Company, and Elsie Adams, co-owner of Adams Abstract Company, from Robert Lee, Texas.
